instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
hey all.

no boot no chime no fan spin
got .6v on ppbus_g3h
and nothing on pp3v42
16.5 on ppchgr_dcin

nothing on L7030

is u7000 dead?

EDIT: no green light

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
yes and i should point out no previous water damage? customer reckons they had trouble with the charger and it died?
UPDATE: short on pp3v42

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
There is a big chance that U7000 is dead, SMC is dead and something else, but lets start with  pp3v42_g3h...

Resistance to GND?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 34262"]There is a big chance that U7000 is dead, SMC is dead and something else, but lets start with pp3v42_g3h...

Resistance to GND?[/QUOTE]

res to gnd is 0

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: Rermove L6995 and check in which side is the short, my bet is SMC dead, U7000 dead, R6990 open, U6990 dead....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: pin 2 of L6995 is short. R6990 is measuring 48ohms

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: R6990 needs to be replaced, inject 3V on pin 2 from L6995 and see what is getting hot....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: this might be dumb but can i use the pprobes on my multimeter and connect to dcps and inject that way?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: and how come r6990 need to be replaced even though it shows 16.8v and ohms are only within 5% tolerance

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: wow im an idiot, mixing everything... R6990 is ok....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="30%"]34286._xfImport[/ATTACH]

ok so after injecting 3V i found L6400 heating mega.
now after removing i wanted to make sure the short on pp3v42 is not short to ground so i test pin 2 L6995 and no beep so its all good. I replaced L6400 and again short. So i removed and check the other end of L6400 which continues as PP_AUDIO_CHS and its short?

what am i doing wrong? could there be multiple shorts to ground OR L6400 is faulty OR something else?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: should i try injecting 3V whilst L6400 also removed to see if anything else heats up?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: shorted C6405 and or C6403...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: yerp. also c6406. replaced short is gone now i can try and figure out why ppbus_g3h is only on .5v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: just another question, with ISL6259 is there a difference between i6259AHRTZ & i6259HRTZ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: Nope same chip. Is 3v42 now 3.42 volts? If so, I’d say check resistance to ground on PPBUS and see what you get.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: 3V42 is ok now????

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 34294"]3V42 is ok now????
[/QUOTE]

yerp. perfectly fine. just trying to figure why no ppbus_g3h
there is power @ q7030 but nothing further.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28 of the ISL6259? Resistance to GND on PPBUS?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
Resistance between 17/18 = 3.3
Resistance between 27/28 = 20.4
Resistance to ppbus = 0.468v (diode mode)'

edit: just found chgr_acin short to ground

edit 2: removed u7000 and no more short on chgr_acin

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 green light no boot
threads.message:
replaced u7000 all working
so if chgr_acin not present no chgr_acok
